article_title: Obama Needs to Help Stop Further Atrocities in South Sudan
article_text:
The atrocities committed across South Sudan since December have ranged from mass killings and rape to the murder of hospital patients lying in their beds. With civil war engulfing the country, farmers have been unable to plant crops, raising the specter of famine. U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon warned last month that by the end of the year, half the country's 12 million people could be either fleeing, starving or dead.

This sudden explosion of violence came as a sickening shock to the people of South Sudan after a...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Benjamin Kahn writes that President Obama needs to empower his Atrocities Prevention Board to prevent further killings in South Sudan.
twitter.title: An Opening for Obama in South Sudan

image.alt: Obama needs to step up to prevent further mass casualties in South Sudan
